Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-PBa (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1a)
Sequence Information.Source: the Peruvian Purple-Sided Leaf Frog,Phyllomedusa baltea, South America

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 50% similarity toPhylloseptin-B1. Predicted to be helical.Activity: Active against S. aureus (MIC 8 ug/ml), E.coli (MIC 128 ug/ml) and C. albicans (MIC 8 ug/ml). In addition, it exhibited anti-proliferative activity against the human cancer cell lines, H460, PC3 and U251MG, but was less active against a normal human cell line (HMEC). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Wan Y, Ma C, Zhou M, Xi X, Li L, Wu D, Wang L, Lin C, Lopez JC, Chen T, Shaw C. 2015
Literature Information.Title: Phylloseptin-PBa--A Novel Broad-Spectrum Antimicrobial Peptide from the Skin Secretion of the Peruvian Purple-Sided Leaf Frog (Phyllomedusa Baltea) Which Exhibits Cancer Cell Cytotoxicity.
